comments: a(n-3) = n^2 - 6, n>=0, with a(-3) = -6, a(-2) = -5, a(-1) = -2 gives the values for a*c of indefinite binary quadratic forms [a, b, c] of discriminant D = 24 for b = 2*n. In general D = b^2 - 4*a*c > 0 and the form [a, b, c] is a*x^2 + b*x*y + c*y^2. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Aug 16 2013
links: P. De Geest, Palindromic Quasipronics of the form n(n+x)

formula: a(n) = 2*n+a(n-1)+5 (with a(0)=3). - _Vincenzo Librandi_, Aug 05 2010From _Bruno Berselli_, Sep 02 2011: (Start)  G.f.: (x+1)*(3-2*x)/(1-x)^3.  a(n) = a(-n-6).  a(n) mod (n+1) = n-1.  (End)a(n) = A000290(n+3) - 6. - _Omar E. Pol_, Dec 12 2012
